Name: acquisition_instrument_model
Description: Manufacturers of an acquisition instrument may offer various versions (models) of that instrument with different features or sensitivities. Differences in features or sensitivities may be relevant to processing or interpretation of the data.

Name: acquisition_instrument_vendor
Description: An acquisition instrument is the device that contains the signal detection hardware and signal processing software. Assays generate signals such as light of various intensities or color or signals representing the molecular mass.

Name: assay_type
Description: Bottom-up refers to analyzing proteins in a sample by digesting them to peptides. Top-down refers to analyzing whole proteins without digestion. LC-MS and MS are for lipids/metabolites. LC-MS Bottom-Up and MS Bottom-Up are for peptides. LC-MS Top-Down and MS Top-Down are for proteins.

Name: contributors_path
Description: Relative path to file with ORCID IDs for contributors for this dataset.

Name: data_collection_mode
Description: Mode of data collection in tandem MS assays. Either DDA (Data-dependent acquisition), DIA (Data-independent acquisition), MRM (multiple reaction monitoring), or PRM (parallel reaction monitoring).

Name: data_path
Description: Relative path to file or directory with instrument data. Downstream processing will depend on filename extension conventions.

Name: description
Description: Free-text description of this assay.

Name: dms
Description: Was differential mobility spectrometry used in this assay?

Name: donor_id
Description: HuBMAP Display ID of the donor of the assayed tissue.

Name: execution_datetime
Description: Start date and time of assay, typically a date-time stamped folder generated by the acquisition instrument. YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm, where YYYY is the year, MM is the month with leading 0s, and DD is the day with leading 0s, hh is the hour with leading zeros, mm are the minutes with leading zeros.

Name: ion_mobility
Description: Specifies whether or not ion mobility spectrometry was performed and which technology was used. Technologies for measuring ion mobility: Traveling Wave Ion Mobility Spectrometry (TWIMS), Trapped Ion Mobility Spectrometry (TIMS), High Field Asymmetric waveform ion Mobility Spectrometry (FAIMS), Drift Tube Ion Mobility Spectrometry (DTIMS, Structures for Lossless Ion Manipulations (SLIM).

Name: is_targeted
Description: Specifies whether or not a specific molecule(s) is/are targeted for detection/measurement by the assay.

Name: label_name
Description: If the samples were labeled (e.g. TMT), provide the name/ID of the label on this sample.

Name: labeling
Description: Indicates whether samples were labeled prior to MS analysis (e.g., TMT)

Name: lc_column_model
Description: The model number/name of the LC Column - IF custom self-packed, pulled tip calillary is used enter "Pulled tip capilary"

Name: lc_column_vendor
Description: OPTIONAL: The manufacturer of the LC Column unless self-packed, pulled tip capilary is used

Name: lc_flow_rate_unit
Description: Units of flow rate.

Name: lc_flow_rate_value
Description: Value of flow rate.

Name: lc_gradient
Description: LC gradient

Name: lc_id_unit
Description: units of LC column inner diameter (typically microns)

Name: lc_id_value
Description: LC column inner diameter (microns)

Name: lc_instrument_model
Description: The model number/name of the instrument used for LC

Name: lc_instrument_vendor
Description: The manufacturer of the instrument used for LC

Name: lc_length_unit
Description: units for LC column length (typically cm)

Name: lc_length_value
Description: LC column length

Name: lc_mobile_phase_a
Description: Composition of mobile phase A

Name: lc_mobile_phase_b
Description: Composition of mobile phase B

Name: lc_resin
Description: Details of the resin used for lc, including vendor, particle size, pore size

Name: lc_temp_unit
Description: units for LC temperature

Name: lc_temp_value
Description: LC temperature

Name: mass_resolving_power
Description: The MS1 resolving power defined as m/∆m where ∆m is the FWHM for a given peak with a specified m/z (m). (unitless)

Name: ms_scan_mode
Description: Indicates whether experiment is MS, MS/MS, or other (possibly MS3 for TMT)

Name: ms_source
Description: The ion source type used for surface sampling.

Name: mz_range_high_value
Description: The high value of the scanned mass range for MS1. (unitless)

Name: mz_range_low_value
Description: The low value of the scanned mass range for MS1. (unitless)

Name: mz_resolving_power
Description: The peak (m/z) used to calculate the resolving power.

Name: operator
Description: Name of the person responsible for executing the assay.

Name: operator_email
Description: Email address for the operator.

Name: overall_protocols_io_doi
Description: DOI for protocols.io for the overall process for this assay.

Name: pi
Description: Name of the principal investigator responsible for the data.

Name: pi_email
Description: Email address for the principal investigator.

Name: polarity
Description: The polarity of the mass analysis (positive or negative ion modes)

Name: processing_protocols_io_doi
Description: DOI for analysis protocols.io for this assay.

Name: processing_search
Description: Software for analyzing and searching LC-MS/MS omics data

Name: protocols_io_doi
Description: DOI for protocols.io referring to the protocol for this assay.

Name: resolution_x_unit
Description: The unit of measurement of the width of a pixel.

Name: resolution_x_value
Description: The width of a pixel.

Name: resolution_y_unit
Description: The unit of measurement of the height of a pixel.

Name: resolution_y_value
Description: The height of a pixel

Name: section_prep_protocols_io_doi
Description: DOI for protocols.io referring to the protocol for preparing tissue sections for the assay.

Name: spatial_sampling_type
Description: Specifies whether or not the analysis was performed in a spatially targeted manner. Spatial profiling experiments target specific tissue foci but do not necessarily generate images. Spatial imaging expriments collect data from a regular array (pixels) that can be visualized as heat maps of ion intensity at each location (molecular images). Leave blank if data are derived from bulk analysis.

Name: spatial_target
Description: Specifies the cell-type or functional tissue unit (FTU) that is targeted in the spatial profiling experiment. Leave blank if data are generated in imaging mode without a specific target structure.

Name: spatial_type
Description: Specifies whether or not the analysis was performed in a spatialy targeted manner and the technique used for spatial sampling. For example, Laser-capture microdissection (LCM), Liquid Extraction Surface Analysis (LESA), Nanodroplet Processing in One pot for Trace Samples (nanoPOTS).

Name: tissue_id
Description: HuBMAP Display ID of the assayed tissue.

Name: version
Description: Version of the schema to use when validating this metadata.
